channel.description: Recent content in rust on exo-cortex: weblog

item.title: rust_tricks_generic_output_functions
item.description: I’m re-writing my network-delay-differential-equations-solver from my master thesis — this time in Rust (of course!). The idea is to learn more about the language. That’s why I try to tackle problems by using clever new approaches that Rust enables me to do. Along the way I there’ve been a few tricks that I learned or that nice people taught me which made it or will make it into the program. This one came from a someone (eqv) who’s much more experienced in such things:
